verses.verse: But now they that are younger <S%H6810><s%> than I have me in derision <S%H7832><s%>, Whose fathers <S%H1><s%> I disdained <S%H3988><s%> to set <S%H7896><s%> with the dogs <S%H3611><s%> of my flock <S%H6629><s%>.
Yea <S%H3581><s%>, the strength of their hands <S%H3027><s%>, whereto <S%H4100><s%> should it profit me <S%H3624><s%>? Men in whom ripe age is perished <S%H6><s%>.

They are gaunt <S%H1565><s%> with want <S%H2639><s%> and famine <S%H3720><s%>; They gnaw <S%H6207><s%> the dry ground <S%H6723><s%>, in the gloom <S%H570><s%> of wasteness <S%H4875><s%> and desolation <S%H7722><s%>.
They pluck <S%H6998><s%> salt-wort <S%H4408><s%> by the bushes <S%H7880><s%>; And the roots <S%H8328><s%> of the broom <S%H7574><s%> are their food <S%H3899><s%>.
They are driven forth <S%H1644><s%> from the midst <S%H1460><s%> of men <S%H7321><s%>; They cry after them as after a thief <S%H1590><s%>;
So that they dwell <S%H7931><s%> in frightful <S%H6178><s%> valleys <S%H5158><s%>, In holes <S%H2356><s%> of the earth <S%H6083><s%> and of the rocks <S%H3710><s%>.
Among the bushes <S%H7880><s%> they bray <S%H5101><s%>; Under the nettles <S%H2738><s%> they are gathered together <S%H5596><s%>.
They are children <S%H1121><s%> of fools <S%H5036><s%>, yea <S%H1121><s%>, children of base men <S%H8034><s%>; They were scourged <S%H5217><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%>.
And now I am become their song <S%H5058><s%>, Yea <S%H4405><s%>, I am a byword unto them.
They abhor <S%H8581><s%> me <S%H7368><s%>, they stand aloof from me <S%H2820><s%>, And spare not to spit <S%H7536><s%> in my face <S%H6440><s%>.
For he hath loosed <S%H6605><s%> his cord <S%H3499><s%>, and afflicted <S%H6031><s%> me <S%H7971><s%>; And they have cast off the bridle <S%H7448><s%> before me <S%H6440><s%>.

Upon my right <S%H3225><s%> hand rise <S%H6965><s%> the rabble <S%H6526><s%>; They thrust aside <S%H7971><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%>, And they cast up <S%H5549><s%> against me their ways <S%H734><s%> of destruction <S%H343><s%>.
They mar <S%H5420><s%> my path <S%H5410><s%>, They set forward <S%H3276><s%> my calamity <S%H1942><s%>, Even men that have no helper <S%H5826><s%>.
As through a wide <S%H7342><s%> breach <S%H6556><s%> they come <S%H857><s%>: In the midst <S%H8478><s%> of the ruin <S%H7722><s%> they roll themselves upon me <S%H1556><s%>.

Terrors <S%H1091><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> upon me <S%H7291><s%>; They chase mine honor <S%H5082><s%> as the wind <S%H7307><s%>; And my welfare <S%H3444><s%> is passed away <S%H5674><s%> as a cloud <S%H5645><s%>.
And now my soul <S%H5315><s%> is poured out <S%H8210><s%> within me <S%H3117><s%>; Days of affliction <S%H6040><s%> have taken hold upon me <S%H270><s%>.
In the night season <S%H3915><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> are pierced <S%H5365><s%> in me <S%H6207><s%>, And the pains that gnaw me take no rest <S%H7901><s%>.
By God <S%H7230><s%>'s great force <S%H3581><s%> is my garment <S%H3830><s%> disfigured <S%H2664><s%>; It bindeth me about <S%H247><s%> as the collar <S%H6310><s%> of my coat <S%H3801><s%>.
He hath cast <S%H3384><s%> me into the mire <S%H2563><s%>, And I am become like <S%H4911><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes <S%H665><s%>.
I cry <S%H7768><s%> unto thee <S%H6030><s%>, and thou dost not answer me <S%H5975><s%>: I stand up, and thou gazest at me <S%H995><s%>.
Thou art turned <S%H2015><s%> to be cruel <S%H393><s%> to me <S%H6108><s%>; With the might of thy hand <S%H3027><s%> thou persecutest me <S%H7852><s%>.
Thou liftest me up <S%H5375><s%> to the wind <S%H7307><s%>, thou causest me to ride <S%H7392><s%> upon it <S%H4127><s%>; And thou dissolvest me in the storm <S%H8454><s%>.
For I know <S%H3045><s%> that thou wilt bring <S%H7725><s%> me to death <S%H4194><s%>, And to the house <S%H1004><s%> appointed <S%H4150><s%> for all living <S%H2416><s%>.
Howbeit doth not one stretch out <S%H7971><s%> the hand <S%H3027><s%> in his fall <S%H1164><s%>? Or in his calamity <S%H6365><s%> therefore cry for help <S%H7769><s%>?
Did not I weep <S%H1058><s%> for him that was in trouble <S%H7186><s%>? Was not my soul <S%H5315><s%> grieved <S%H5701><s%> for the needy <S%H34><s%>?
When I looked <S%H6960><s%> for good <S%H2896><s%>, then evil <S%H7451><s%> came <S%H935><s%>; And when I waited <S%H3176><s%> for light <S%H216><s%>, there came <S%H935><s%> darkness <S%H652><s%>.
My heart <S%H4578><s%> is troubled <S%H7570><s%>, and resteth <S%H1826><s%> not <S%H3117><s%>; Days of affliction <S%H6040><s%> are come upon me <S%H6923><s%>.
I go <S%H1980><s%> mourning <S%H6937><s%> without the sun <S%H2535><s%>: I stand up <S%H6965><s%> in the assembly <S%H6951><s%>, and cry for help <S%H7768><s%>.
I am a brother <S%H251><s%> to jackals <S%H8577><s%>, And a companion <S%H7453><s%> to ostriches <S%H1323><s%>.
My skin <S%H5785><s%> is black <S%H7835><s%>, and falleth from me <S%H6106><s%>, And my bones are burned <S%H2787><s%> with heat <S%H2721><s%>.
Therefore is my harp <S%H3658><s%> turned to mourning <S%H60><s%>, And my pipe <S%H5748><s%> into the voice <S%H6963><s%> of them that weep <S%H1058><s%>.
